question: Before his appointment as Viceroy of India, Lord Linlithgow served in which among the following post?
option1: Chairman of the Royal Commission on Indian Agriculture
option2: Chairman of the Joint Select Committee of Indian Constitutional Reforms
option3: As an assistant of drafting of the Government of India Act, 1935
explanation: Lord Linlithgow served as the Viceroy of India from 1936 to 1943. Before his appointment as Viceroy of India, he served as the Chairman of the Royal Commission on Indian Agriculture in the year 1926, As the Chairman of the Joint Select Committee of Indian Constitutional Reforms from April 1933 to November 1934, and as an assistant of the drafting of the Government of India Act, 1935.
